results.title: Amelia and the angel
results.creator_credit: Ken Russell and Anthony G. Evans
results.brief_description: A surreal fairy tale about a little girl in search of a pair of angel’s wings. The story is set in a background of London scenes, South Kensington, Earl’s Court, the Albert Memorial and Rotten Row. In the course of her search she visits a junk shop down the road, a jumble stall and finally tracks down a perfect pair of wings in a crazy artist’s studio. An interesting contrast is provided between the high-quality location photography and the surreal intrusions by a collection of fairy-tale characters. Suitable for lower and middle primary levels.

results.title: Ambush at Masai Mara and Leopard, a Darkness in the Grass
results.brief_description: Ambush at Masai Mara - The wildebeest are coming and the hunt is on! It is the time of plenty for the lions of the Musiara marsh. Nothing quite matches the awesome spectacle of the annual wildebeest migration as the vast herds brave the treacherous waters of the fast flowing Mara River and run the gauntlet of the marsh lions. “Leopard: a Darkness in the Grass” - Survival on the hot plains of Africa is a tightrope between life and death, even for the big cats. The leopard is a shy and elusive prowler and this intimate film follows the extraordinary and hazardous events in the daily life of one particular leopard and her cubs in Masai Mara. Narrated by David Attenborough. Rated: G

results.title: Ambulance
results.creator_credit: Sophie Lavence and RMIT Media Arts
results.brief_description:
Video art exploring notion of voyeur and viewer using split screen technique and a fading in and out of images. No dialogue - ambient music soundtrack.
Graduate work from RMIT media arts (BA Arts)

results.title: Ambrose Bierce's 'Parker Adderson: Philosopher'
results.creator_credit: Arthur Barron, Ozzie Brown and Perspective Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The American Short Story”.
Parker Adderson is a captured Yankee spy whose facile philosophy and flippant concern for life arouse a Confederate general’s instinct for sham. The harsh reality of his impending execution brings abrupt character changes in Adderson, and a vicious battle in the general’s tent ensues.

results.title: Ambassadors discuss the decade for women
results.creator_credit: Judith Dahlitz and Centre for Social Development and Humanitarian Affairs (United Nations)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Women’s Decade”.
Four heads of permanent missions to the United Nations discuss the issues of women’s rights. 1976-1985 has been designated as the United Nations decade for women, and a female journalist interviews these four male ambassadors about aims for this decade.

results.title: Amazon: The Flooded Forest
results.brief_description: The Amazonian rainforest, flooded by up to ten metres of water every year, is one of the world’s last wetland frontiers. A magical submerged world and the greatest river system on earth, these huge flood plains are home to many remarkable creatures. The animals featured in this two part production include the primitive freshwater Boho dolphin, the Arowhana fish, dubbed by locals “the water monkey” because of its ability to leap two metres from the water to catch insects, and the strangest-looking monkey in the world, the Ukari. Narrated by Anthony Hopkins.

results.title: Amazon to ice
results.brief_description: Explore the wonderous waterways of South America from the infamous Tierra del Fuego to the raging rapids of the Upper Amazon; an area studded with relics from the ancient Inca past. A truly breathtaking journey includes the Moreno Glacier, the face of the Iguazu Falls and a visit to the inhabitants of the Islands in Lake Titicaca.

results.title: Amazing platypus [Italian version]
results.creator_credit: John Shaw, John Morris and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: The playtpus is one of nature’s shy creatures. Only twice has a playtpus bred in captivity. Because they are found only in Australia, and will not breed in zoos, most people know very little about the playtpus. This exceptional film shows the playtpus on dry land, underwater and by means of a carefully sectioned burrow , we even follow him into his home.
